Accommodation:
We have an accommodation booked for the days from 16. April to 20. April in Arbatax, Eastern Sardinian Coast.
Villa Sangemi
The accommodation is currently booked for 10 people.
The second accommodation booked for the days from 20. April to 23. April in Torre dei Corsari, Western Sardinia.
BlueMaison
The accommodation is currently booked for 10 people.
Costs:
• 120,4€ per person from 16. to 20. April 2025, apartment in Arbatax
  • 84,06€ per person from 20. to 23. April 2025, apartment in Torre dei Corsari

Description:
To reminisce our trip to Crete last year, we will spend our Easter in the second biggest island in the Mediterranean.
Sardinia.
Concrete plans are as follows.
In the meantime, please check out how the planning has progressed in Wanderlog..
Wanderlog Link

DAY-1 (16 April 2025)

We fly in to Olbia Airport and collect our rented car there, making our way to the nearest Supermarket.
After shopping, we drive to our Apartment, Villa Sangemi in Arbatax, Eastern Sardinian Coast.

DAY-2 (17April 2025)

Hike between Caletta Fuili Cala di Luna

DAY-3 (18 April 2025)

Hike to Monte Nova San Giovanni

DAY-4 (19 April 2025)

Hike in Capo Carbonara

DAY-5 (20 April 2025)

We will move to our second accomodation in Western Sardinia this day.
But first we visit the beaches and ruins there, by doing to easy hikes.
Hike in the Cape of San Marco
The next hike is 9 minutes away.
Hike through the Turr'e Seu Nature Park to the rice grain beach Spiaggia Maimoni
After shopping, we drive to our Apartment, BlueMaison in Torre dei Corsari, Western Sardinia.

DAY-6 (21 April 2025)

This day we will hike through a marshland national park, with wild horses roaming around and visit the biggest bronze age ruins in Sardinia (Su Nuraxi).
Hike to Parco della Giara
Alternatively, we could also just decide to chill by the sea.

DAY-7 (22 April 2025)

We could do a hike this day, to a Waterfall, but the hike is very optional.
We could just chill and try to find some sea food.
If you wanna chill.., do not read the plans for the day.
Hike to Cascate di Muru Mannu
This is a visit to an ancient Graeco-Roman Temple Ruins and a cave, even though the hike is planned, one could just visit the interesting places under 5 km and come back.
Hike to the Archaeological areas of Antas and Mannau valleys
The ones who decide to go, on the hike, can join us on the Beach Piscinas or for making things easy Beach Torre dei Corsari, near our accomodation.

DAY-8 (23 April 2025)

This day, we say goodbeye to Sardinia, but before we take our flight..
We will drive to Olbia and explore the city.
In the evening we fly back from Olbia Airport, after giving back the rented cars there.

RelatedEvents.Description: We will visit some magnificent beaches and walk through come anceint Nugares and natural caves.
RelatedEvents.Name: East Sardinia: Hike between Caletta Fuili Cala di Luna

RelatedEvents.Description: The protected area with its numerous bays, sandy beaches and dune strips is popular with vacationers in southern Sardinia.
RelatedEvents.Name: Southeast Sardinia : Hike in Capo Carbonara

RelatedEvents.Description: We will hike among wild horses in the Parco della Giara and visit the ancient site at Su Nuraxi.
RelatedEvents.Name: South-Central Sardinia : Hike to Parco della Giara

RelatedEvents.Description: Excursion to the Water Festival in the Monte Linas Gorges.
RelatedEvents.Name: Southwest Sardinia : Hike to Cascate di Muru Mannu

RelatedEvents.Description: The Roman-Punic temple complex of Antas and the stalactite cave Grotta su Mannau are major tourist attractions in the Iglesiente mountains.
RelatedEvents.Name: South Sardinia : Hike to the Archaeological areas of Antas and Mannau valleys

RelatedEvents.Description: The Cape of the Romans and Phoenicians...
RelatedEvents.Name: Eastern Sardinia : Hike in the Cape of San Marco

RelatedEvents.Description: The main attraction of the Sinis peninsula are the beaches of Is Arutas, Mari Ermi and Maimoni. The beaches are mostly made up of small, round ash particles.
RelatedEvents.Name: East Sardinia : Hike through the Turr'e Seu Nature Park to the rice grain beach Spiaggia Maimoni

RelatedEvents.Description: The Pratobello plateau south of Orgosolo is one of the most beautiful in Sardinia. In the stone huts you walk through a beautiful landscape with small streams, rocky outcrops and barren pastures.
RelatedEvents.Name: Western Sardinia : Hike to Monte Nova San Giovanni

SubImages.Description:
Much of Sardinia’s landscape is made up of exposed granite rock, often
resembling something from another planet. Make like Neil Armstrong as
you venture into the Codula di Luna – the “Valley of the Moon” – on one of
the island’s top hiking trails.
SubImages.Name: Codula di Luna

SubImages.Description:
Famed for its herds of wild horses, the lush plateau of La Giara di Gesturi
is a captivating landscape for trekkers. Formed by lava flows around 3
million years ago, the area is peppered with clusters of ancient, crooked
oak and cork trees, interspersed by sturdy maquis that’s especially
beautiful in the spring.
SubImages.Name: La Giara di Gesturi

SubImages.Description:
With a rugged landscape that encompasses forbidding
mountains, verdant pastures, craggy plateaus and ancient
forests – not to mention a spectacular stretch of coastline
along the Golfo di Orosei – this park is a natural haven for
wildlife and walkers alike.
SubImages.Name: Gennargentu National Park

SubImages.Description:
Stretching for 7 km (4 miles), the golden sands at Piscinas
beach form an undulating dunescape of wild beauty that is
ever changing with the wind.
SubImages.Name: The golden dunes of Piscinas beach
